channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Mattress left outside by resident on pavement, 18th November
item.description:
The flytipping at this address is very frequent. I have emailed about other instances however this seems to be a problem for this person every 2 weeks. Currently, they have left a mattress outside on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Bramcote Grove, Bermondsey, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Abandoned Car, 18th November
item.description:

item.title: Traffic light timing causing chaos, 18th November
item.description:
The new traffic light signal timings is causing chaos as the turning right time allow for 3 cars to turn from Hurst road onto halfway street. Previously the green light allowed more cars to turn. Now traffic is backing up on Hurst road meaning we cannot access the nursery, gym or exit these due to the waiting cars to turn right blocking the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurst Road, Longlands, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electricity cables entangled in overgrown trees, 18th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31,29,27,25,23,21,19,17,15,13,11,9,7,5,3,1, Rosemary Avenue, Finchley, East Finchley, London Borough of Barnet

item.title: X2 street lights in alley not working, 18th November
item.description:
Alley was between Durham Road and Winchester road. 2 Street lights not working after dark. 1 light at top of hill is working. 2 further down alley are not working Path is steep and covered in wet leaves so is dangerous to use. Please fix the street lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baydon Court, Shortlands, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal stud from broken bollard sticking out of road, 18th November
item.description:
A metal stud is sticking out of the road and Iâ€™ve witnessed a number of people trip over this stud as this is a busy pedestrian area and the stud is not easily visible. It appears that one of the bollards that closes Tooley Street has broken and the metal stud is all that remains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, The Borough, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
